intro: Micromeria biflora var. rhodesiaca, commonly known as the Rhodesian micromeria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its aromatic, finely divided leaves. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the cooler months. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or open habitats. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
